column1: Masaya (Spanish pronunciation: [maˈsaʝa]) is a department in Nicaragua. It is the country's smallest department by area (590 km²) and has a population of 317
column2: 500 (2005 census). The capital is the city of Masaya. It is famous among Nicaraguan people for its nickname
column3: "La Cuna Del Folklore" which translates to (The Cradle of Folklore). It is also the home of the Masaya Volcano
column4: an active 635m volcano which last erupted in 2016.
